intro: Cytinus hypocistis subsp. lutescens, commonly known as the yellow sand mat, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its distinctive pod-like fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces a unique, inflated fruit that splits open to release seeds. Cytinus hypocistis subsp. lutescens is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
